lines.text: Well, you Honor, it was like thls. It was a Sunday afternoon, and I was on my way home from the pool hall - I mean, Sunday school. I always go to Sunday school. I was full of the spirit of brotherly love.

[Voice over]
I'm always communing with nature.
Go on, you joik! Act your own age!
Oh, that's my grandmother. She has a terrific hangover... I mean, she's very, very ill.
My, what big eyes you have, Mr. Wolf.
The better to observe the wonders of Mother Nature with, grandma.
And what a beautiful fur coat you have. Should bring in about thirty-five bucks. So handsome, silky-smooth, sleek and stunning.
I try to keep myself tidy. My, what a big mallet you have, Granny.
All the better to get at your fur coat!
...And it was only though a miracle that I escaped with me life.
And if that ain't the truth, I hope - I hope I get run over by a streetcar.
[Suddenly a streetcar bursts through the wall, running over the Wolf]
Well, maybe I did exagerate just a little bit.
